description: From Middle English hinderance, hinderaunce, hindraunce, hynderaunce, hynderawnce, hynderawns, hyndrance; equivalent to hinder +â€Ž -ance.

entries.meaning: Something which hinders: something that holds back or causes problems with something else.
examples: High-heeled shoes may be fashionable, but they can also be a hindrance to walking.

entries.meaning: The state or act of hindering something
examples: Your hindrance of this process will not be tolerated.
